master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard URLs like http://localhost are also acceptable.

zk.description: ZooKeeper URL for storing state. Format: zk://host1:port1,host2:port2,.../path. Please note that the id is appended to the path.

webui-host.description: For debugging: use this host for WEBUI request.

proxy-port.description: Proxy port, use '0' to let Mesos select a port for you.

framework-port.description: Framework port, use '0' to let Mesos select a port for you.

framework-cpus.description: cpus resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-mem.description: mem resources needed for each framework instance.

framework-instances.description: number of instances of the framework to run.

framework-user.description: user under which to run the framework tasks

async-replication.description: Whether we do asynchronous replication, possible values: "true", "false"

minimal-resources-agent.description: Minimal mesos resources for an agent

minimal-resources-coordinator.description: Minimal mesos resources for a coordinator

minimal-resources-dbserver.description: Minimal mesos resources for a DBserver

minimal-resources-secondary.description: Minimal mesos resources for a secondary DBserver

failover-timeout.description: Timeout after which an automatic failover is done.

mesos-authenticate.description: If true use authentication with Mesos master.

secondaries-with-dbservers.description: Flag, if each secondary must run on a node with a DBServer

coordinators-with-dbservers.description: Flag, if each coordinator must run on a node with a DBServer

arangodb-privileged-image.description: Run arangodb image in privileged mode.

arangodb-ssl-keyfile.description: Enable SSL using this base64 encoded SSL keyfile (see ArangoDB docs for keyfile specification)

arangodb-enterprise-key.description: Use enterprise edition using the following key

arangodb-additional-agent-args.description: Additional arangod arguments to use when starting an agent (see arangod --help)

arangodb-additional-dbserver-args.description: Additional arangod arguments to use when starting a dbserver (see arangod --help)

arangodb-additional-secondary-args.description: Additional arangod arguments to use when starting a secondary dbserver (see arangod --help)

arangodb-additional-coordinator-args.description: Additional arangod arguments to use when starting a coordinator (see arangod --help)
